title: FBI support for TV series "Manhunt" (2017-2020)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to FBI support for or collaboration with the production of the Discovery TV series "Manhunt" (2017-2020), created by Andrew Sodroski, Jim Clemente, and Tony Gittelson. Such documents may include, but should not be limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the FBI and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Manhunt," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication. I request a search of all locations where such documents might be located, including but not limited to the entertainment liaison offices and communications HQ or similar offices.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Jail Booking Logs 2023-2024

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Jail Booking Logs 2023-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records related to individuals booked into the Whitley County Jail from Jan 1, 2023 through Dec 31, 2024, as maintained in the ordinary course.

For each booking, please provide:
-Inmate ID and booking number (if different)
-Associated court case/docket number(s)
-Full name and last known address
-Date/time of arrest, arresting agency, and type of arrest (warrantless or warrant-based) (if warrant-based, include warrant/bench-warrant number and issuing court if recorded)
-Date/time of booking
-Date/time of release (if released)
-Reason for release and receiving agency if transferred
-Bond type (cash/recognizance/surety/other) and bond amount
-Bond set date/time and setting authority (judge/magistrate/standard schedule)
-Bond posted date/time and posting method (cash/10%/surety/OR)
-Inmate residency status (in-state or out-of-state)
-Holds/detainers active during custody (type and issuing agency)
-Probable cause milestones:
--Date/time PC affidavit received by jail or transmitted to court (if tracked)
--Date/time of probable cause determination and judicial officer (if recorded)

Also provide: any data dictionary/code tables needed to interpret bond types, release reasons, holds, or status codes.

These items are requested only to the extent they are recorded in the normal course of business. If any listed field is not tracked, please produce the export with all available fields and identify which fields are not maintained.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitley Accountabity Project

title: Edward Emerson “Ed” Clark, (May 4, 1930 - June 18, 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Edward Emerson “Ed” Clark, (May 4, 1930 - June 18, 2025)
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Edward Emerson “Ed” Clark. He was born on May 4, 1930 and died on June 18, 2025.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

Edward E. Clark  was an attorney, Navy veteran, as well as the 1980 Libertarian Party candidate for President.

PROOF OF DEATH

Attached is Mr. Clark’s obituary from Reason Magazine.

SCOPE OF SEARCH
Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies at FBI Headquarters. Please also conduct a search for records at the Alexandria Records Center and the Central Records Complex (CRC) in Winchester/Frederick County, Virginia. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed or transferred to NARA, please produce all records related to the transfer or destruction. If previously-released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

FEES

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you nonetheless decide to charge me fees, please inform me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you for your processing of this request.

Yours truly,
Nicholas Sarwark

title: Arizona Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety audits and network sharing (Maricopa County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Arizona Public Records Act Request: Flock Safety audits and network sharing (Maricopa County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the department’s Flock Safety system:

1. Organization Audit in Flock. 
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of December 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Flock networks shared with me Devices List (Please see https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2022/11/17/CPRA_REQUEST.pdf
https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2022/11/09/1938_001.pdf as examples of the lists from other jurisdictions.
3c. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable. Please do not redirect me to your transparency portal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

title: Columbia University communications (U.S. Department of Education)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Columbia University communications (U.S. Department of Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications (including emails, text messages, memos and meeting notes) sent to and from the department concerning the resolution agreement made with Columbia University on July 23, 2025. A copy of said agreement can be found here: https://president.columbia.edu/sites/default/files/content/July%202025%20Announcement/Columbia%20University%20Resolution%20Agreement.pdf. I request communications specifically related to the agreement's section IV, clause 20.

This includes communications sent between members of the same department; between separate departments; and between a department and Columbia University.

I request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

title: Records of Middle East Broadcasting Center

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records of Middle East Broadcasting Center
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'm looking for any record of any media type or communication that the CIA might be in possession of regarding the Middle East Broadcasting Center. The Middle East Broadcasting Center was founded in 1991 and was reorganized into the MBC Group in 2003. I would like any of those records from 1991 to 2003.

I'm also looking for any record that the CIA may be in possession of, of journalist/ reporter for the Middle East Broadcasting Center named Baker Atyani, also misspelled in many post 2001 articles as Bakr Atiani or Bakr Ariani. I'm looking on any records related this journalist between 1991 and 2015.

Additionally, I'm looking for any record that the CIA may be in possession of, of Washington Post reporter Pamela Constable between 2000-2001.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Kallas

title: Request for Digital Forensics Records under the CPRA (Gov. Code § 6250 et seq.)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Request for Digital Forensics Records under the CPRA (Gov. Code § 6250 et seq.)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

access to and copies of any and all public records pertaining to digital forensic analysis or review conducted in connection with:

– Name: Adonis Gaynor
– Date of Birth: 11/09/1975
– Date Range: January 1, 2020 to Present

I Specifically Request the Following Records:

1. All digital forensic reports involving the above subject.
2. Extraction logs, tool usage logs, and examination metadata.
3. AXIOM case exports, including any .html, .bin, .zip, .pdf, or similar forensic file formats.
4. Search warrants, affidavits, and/or consent forms authorizing any digital forensic examination or extraction.
5. Chain of custody records, submission logs, or analyst worksheets connected to the forensic processing of any device or account.
6. Logs identifying the name(s) of digital forensic tools used, including but not limited to:

– Magnet AXIOM / AXIOM Cyber
– Cellebrite UFED / Physical Analyzer
– Berla iVe
– GrayKey, Oxygen Forensic Detective, XRY, BlackBag, or any other tool used by your office or partner agencies

8.

9. Any communications or inter-agency records referencing the use of such tools in conjunction with any devices, accounts, or digital data belonging to me.

If portions of documents are exempt, please redact where necessary and provide the non-exempt material. If any part of this request is unclear or would benefit from narrowing, I’m happy to assist.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mr. adonis gaynor

All records pertaining to the detention, care, death, and post-death inquiry for Johnny Noviello, (DOB: 7/1/1975; DOD: 6/25/2025), who died in ICE custody after incarceration at BOP's Federal Detention Center - Miami facility. See https://www.ice.gov/doclib/foia/reports/ddr_NOVIELLOJohnny.pdf. 

This request includes, but is not limited to, the following records: 

1. Any Mortality Review  and associated working papers conducted by ICE Health Services Corps or the Bureau of Prisons
2. Any Death Review conducted by ICE ERAU or BOP
3. Any Healthcare and Security Compliance Analysis or similar document created by Creative Corrections or another Contractor
4. All extant video showing Mr. Noviello in ICE or BOP custody.
5. All BOP and/or ICE medical records for Mr. Noviello. 
6. Any Executive Summary or Findings information regarding Mr. Noviello's death
7. Any autopsy report for Mr. Noviello, complete with toxicology. 
8. Records of any contract discrepancy reports or similar findings.

I request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 C.F.R. 5.5(e) and declare under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that the following statements are true and correct to the best of my knowledge and understanding: 

1. I am a member of the news media investigating and reporting edited pieces on deaths in ICE custody and abuses of power by federal law enforcement agencies. See, e.g., https://theappeal.org/authors/andrew-free/. 
2. Mr. Noviello is the first ICE detainee to die in a BOP facility in over a decade. 
3. His death in BOP's FDC Miami following his imprisonment at Krome Service Processing Center has been the subject of widespread media coverage about which serious questions exist as to the care the government provided him. 
4. ICE's Miami Field Office has overseen the custody and care of at least six (6) people, including Mr. Noviello, who died in ICE custody in FY25--the most of any field office in the United States.
5. An urgent need exists for the public to obtain, review, and understand the circumstances surrounding Mr. Noviello's death in custody as ICE deaths continue to rise to their highest levels since the Covid pandemic and the agency is poised to massively expand ICE detention capacity.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the deaths of the following individuals:

- Name: Isaiah Sept, Date of birth: 10-07-1973, Date of death: 02-03-2006

- Name: James Prinz, Date of birth: 10-17-1969, Date of death: 08-20-2017

- Name: Pete Coonce, Date of birth: 05-31-1998, Date of death: 11-14-2020

- Name: Lathina Decosta, Date of birth: 08-03-1993, Date of death: 11-14-2020

- Name: David Mandeville, Date of birth: 01-31-1991, Date of death: 06-06-2021

- Name: Jordan Young, Date of birth: 01-12-1982, Date of death: 09-28-2022

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at abauman@openvallejo.org, or by phone at (707) 561-2108. Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely,
Dillon Bergin

title: Tiger Team

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Tiger Team
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I seek all records related to a special Department of Homeland Security task force known internally as the “Tiger Team.”

On July 10, 2025, Homeland Security Investigations official Peter Hatch testified in American Association of University Professors v. U.S. Department of Justice, Civ. No. 1:25-cv-10910 (D. Mass). Hatch testified that in early 2025, DHS convened a special task force known internally as the “Tiger Team” to identify noncitizens protesting against Israel’s ongoing genocide of the Palestinian people, revoke their legal immigration status, and have them deported.

I request all records related to the Tiger Team. These include, without limitation:

1. All records related to the conception and creation of Tiger Team.
2. Records sufficient to identify the structure, composition, and membership of Tiger Team.
3. Records sufficient to identify the mission and mandate of Tiger Team.
4. All records related to the activities of Tiger Team.
5. Records sufficient to identify all other government persons and entities with which Tiger Team has collaborated, interacted, or corresponded.
6. Records sufficient to identify all non-government persons and entities with which Tiger Team has collaborated, interacted, or corresponded.
7. All records related to the oversight of Tiger Team, including records sufficient to identify the persons and entities responsible for that oversight.
8. If Tiger Team is no longer active, all records relating to the end of Tiger Team’s activities, including records sufficient to identify all reasons for ending those activities.
9. All records constituting or relating to any analysis, reports, advice, recommendations, opinions, discussions, or communications regarding the legality of Tiger Team’s activities, including whether those activities might violate the First Amendment.

Date Range: November 5, 2024 to August 1, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Francis Lee Maidir
